english: How are you?

german: Mir geht es gut, danke. Und dir?
english: I'm fine, thank you. And you?
Also good, thank you.
What are you doing today?
I'm going shopping.
What are you buying?
I'm buying fruits and vegetables.

german: Hast du gestern den Film gesehen?
english: Did you watch the movie yesterday?

german: Ja, ich habe ihn gesehen. Und du?
english: Yes, I watched it. And you?

german: Nein, ich habe keine Zeit gehabt.
english: No, I didn't have time.
What do you like to eat?
I like to eat pizza.
When do you go to bed?

german: Ich gehe normalerweise um 10 Uhr ins Bett.
english: I usually go to bed at 10 o'clock.

german: Was machst du in deiner Freizeit?
english: What do you do in your free time?

german: Ich lese gerne Bücher und spiele Tennis.
english: I like to read books and play tennis.
Do you have siblings?

german: Ja, ich habe einen Bruder und eine Schwester.
english: Yes, I have a brother and a sister.
What are your hobbies?

german: Meine Hobbys sind Fotografie und Wandern.
english: My hobbies are photography and hiking.
How was your weekend?

german: Mein Wochenende war gut. Ich habe mit Freunden gespielt.
english: My weekend was good. I played with friends.
Do you like going to the cinema?

german: Ja, ich gehe gerne ins Kino.
english: Yes, I like going to the cinema.
What is your favorite movie?

german: Mein Lieblingsfilm ist 'Der Herr der Ringe'.
english: My favorite movie is 'The Lord of the Rings'.
What do you do for a living?
I am a teacher/computer scientist/doctor/student.
Where do you live?
I live in Berlin.
How is the weather today?
It is sunny and warm.

german: Was machst du gerne am Wochenende?
english: What do you like to do on the weekend?

german: Ich gehe gerne spazieren und treffe Freunde.
english: I like to go for walks and meet friends.
What did you do yesterday?

german: Ich habe mit meiner Familie gegessen und ferngesehen.
english: I ate with my family and watched TV.
What is your favorite food?
My favorite food is pasta.

german: Was machst du, um dich zu entspannen?
english: What do you do to relax?

german: Ich höre Musik und lese ein Buch.
english: I listen to music and read a book.
What is your favorite music?
My favorite music is rock.

german: Was sind deine Pläne für heute?
english: What are your plans for today?

german: Ich gehe einkaufen und treffe Freunde.
english: I'm going shopping and meeting friends.
What was your most beautiful experience?

german: Mein schönstes Erlebnis war meine Reise nach Italien.
english: My most beautiful experience was my trip to Italy.
What is your favorite book?
My favorite book is 'Harry Potter'.

german: Was machst du gerne in deiner Freizeit?
english: What do you like to do in your free time?

german: Ich gehe gerne ins Kino und spiele Fußball.
english: I like to go to the cinema and play soccer.
What do you like to do the most?

german: Am liebsten lese ich ein gutes Buch.
english: I like to read a good book the most.
How old are you?
I am 25 years old.

german: Was machst du gerne bei schlechtem Wetter?
english: What do you like to do in bad weather?

german: Ich koche gerne oder schaue Filme zu Hause.
english: I like to cook or watch movies at home.
What is your dream vacation destination?
My dream vacation destination is the Maldives.
Do you have pets?

german: Ja, ich habe einen Hund namens Max.
english: Yes, I have a dog named Max.
What is your favorite sport?
My favorite sport is swimming.

german: Was war das letzte Buch, das du gelesen hast?
english: What was the last book you read?

german: Das letzte Buch, das ich gelesen habe, war 'Die Verwandlung' von Franz Kafka.
english: The last book I read was 'The Metamorphosis' by Franz Kafka.
What is your morning routine?

german: Mein morgendliches Ritual besteht darin, Yoga zu machen und einen Kaffee zu trinken.
english: My morning routine involves doing yoga and having a coffee.
What is your favorite drink?
My favorite drink is green tea.

german: Was würdest du tun, wenn du im Lotto gewinnen würdest?
english: What would you do if you won the lottery?

german: Wenn ich im Lotto gewinnen würde, würde ich eine Weltreise machen und ein Haus am Strand kaufen.
english: If I won the lottery, I would go on a world tour and buy a house by the beach.

german: Was war das letzte Konzert, auf dem du warst?
english: What was the last concert you attended?
